com.marklogic.hub

Interface DataHub

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataHubImpl

    public interface DataHub
    Handles creation and orchastration of DHF with a MarkLogic server. Includes installs, version validation, updates, and the init of a DHF project.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearDatabase(java.lang.String database)
      Clears the database of all documents
      void clearUserModules()
      Removes user's modules from the modules db

      Returns name of what is using the port
      java.lang.String getServerVersion()
      Returns the string presentation of the server version, eg: "9.03-1"
      void initProject()
      Initializes the project on disk, creates scaffold project code
      void install()
      Installs the data hub configuration and server-side config files into MarkLogic Must be run as a user with sufficient privileges to install a data hub.

      Installs the data hub configuration and server-side config files into MarkLogic Must be run as a user with sufficient privileges to install a data hub.

      Updates the indexes in the database based on the project Must be run as a user with data-hub-admin-role or equivalent

    • Method Detail

      • clearDatabase

        void clearDatabase(java.lang.String database)
        Clears the database of all documents
        Parameters:
        database - - the name of the database in string form

      • isInstalled

        InstallInfo isInstalled()
        Determines if the data hub is installed in MarkLogic
        Returns:
        true if installed, false otherwise

      • isServerVersionValid

        boolean isServerVersionValid(java.lang.String versionString)
        Validates the MarkLogic server to ensure compatibility with the hub
        Parameters:
        versionString - - the version of the server to validate
        Returns:
        true if valid, false otherwise
        Throws:
        ServerValidationException - if the server is not compatible

      • initProject

        void initProject()
        Initializes the project on disk, creates scaffold project code

      • clearUserModules

        void clearUserModules()
        Removes user's modules from the modules db

      • runPreInstallCheck

        java.util.HashMap runPreInstallCheck()
        Runs the pre-install check for the datahub populating the object with variables necessary to perform the install. This is used for running install. Must be run as a user with sufficient privileges to install a data hub.
        Returns:
        - a hashmap of the results of the preinstall check

      • install

        void install()
        Installs the data hub configuration and server-side config files into MarkLogic Must be run as a user with sufficient privileges to install a data hub.

      • install

        void install(HubDeployStatusListener listener)
        Installs the data hub configuration and server-side config files into MarkLogic Must be run as a user with sufficient privileges to install a data hub.
        Parameters:
        listener - - the callback method to receive status updates

      • updateIndexes

        void updateIndexes()
        Updates the indexes in the database based on the project Must be run as a user with data-hub-admin-role or equivalent

      • uninstall

        void uninstall()
        Uninstalls the data hub configuration, server-side config files and final databases and servers from MarkLogic Must be run as a user with sufficient privileges to install a data hub.

      • uninstall

        void uninstall(HubDeployStatusListener listener)
        Uninstalls the data hub configuration, server-side config files and final databases and servers from MarkLogic Must be run as a user with sufficient privileges to install a data hub.
        Parameters:
        listener - - the callback method to receive status updates

      • isSafeToInstall

        boolean isSafeToInstall()
        Checks to make sure all the versions and database in a valid configuration with version check Must be run as a user with sufficient privileges to install a data hub.
        Returns:
        boolean - if not, returns false, if safe to proceed ahead returns true

      • isPortInUse

        boolean isPortInUse(DatabaseKind kind)
        Checks to see if the port is in use
        Parameters:
        kind - - the DatabaseKind enum value (ex STAGING or JOB)
        Returns:
        true if the port is in use, false if it is not

      • setPortInUseBy

        void setPortInUseBy(DatabaseKind kind,
                    java.lang.String usedBy)
        Sets what appserver name is using the port
        Parameters:
        kind - - the DatabaseKind enum value (ex STAGING or JOB)
        usedBy - - string name of what is using the port

      • getPortInUseBy

        java.lang.String getPortInUseBy(DatabaseKind kind)
        Returns name of what is using the port
        Parameters:
        kind - - the DatabaseKind enum value (ex STAGING or JOB)
        Returns:
        name of who using the port

      • isServerVersionOk

        boolean isServerVersionOk()
        Checks to see if the datahub and server versions are compatible
        Returns:
        true if the server version matches, false if it does not

      • setServerVersionOk

        void setServerVersionOk(boolean serverVersionOk)
        Sets true or false if the server version is okay with this version of DHF
        Parameters:
        serverVersionOk - - true if it compatible or false if it is not

      • getServerVersion

        java.lang.String getServerVersion()
        Returns the string presentation of the server version, eg: "9.03-1"
        Returns:
        server version as a string, eg: "9.03-1"

      • setServerVersion

        void setServerVersion(java.lang.String serverVersion)
        Sets the server version holder on the datahub object - currently unused
        Parameters:
        serverVersion - - server version as a string, eg: "9.03-1"

      • upgradeHub

        boolean upgradeHub()
            throws CantUpgradeException
        Upgrades the installed datahub on the server to this version of the DataHub Must be run as a user with sufficient privileges to install a data hub.
        Returns:
        true or false based on success of the upgrade
        Throws:
        CantUpgradeException - - exception thrown when an upgrade can't happen

      • upgradeHub

        boolean upgradeHub(java.util.List<java.lang.String> updatedFlows)
            throws CantUpgradeException
        Upgrades the hub based on list of provided updated flows. All flows SHOULD be provided. The method without params will handle this automatically. Must be run as a user with sufficient privileges to install a data hub.
        Parameters:
        updatedFlows - - the list of the name of the flows you want to update
        Returns:
        boolean - false if upgrade fails for a reason other than an upgrade exception
        Throws:
        CantUpgradeException - - should the hub fail to upgrade for incompatibility reasons
